title: Introducing: MISSIO
body:
Given the tragic events unfolding in France over the past few days, there’s something rather chilling about sitting here listening to a cover of a song originally released in 1994 focusing on the [IRA terrorist bombing](http://en.

wikipedia.org/wiki/Warrington_bomb_attacks) a year earlier in Warrington which claimed two lives. The cover in question, by Austin’s **MISSIO** is a hauntingly beautiful take on The Cranberries’ [Zombie](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Ejga4kJUts), a poignant ode to Tim Parry and Jonathan Ball, yet more broadly feels like a plea to stop the senseless slaughter of innocents. That coincidental connection aside, it’s a gorgeously layered composition; as is _I Run To You_, his debut single, a blossoming, emotionally wrought ballad, that more than marks MISSIO out as one to be keeping an eye on. Stay free. Stay peaceful.
